segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosalesu viharati ekasālāyaṃ brāhmaṇagāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Kosalans near the brahmin village of Ekasālā.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā mahatiyā gihiparisāya parivuto dhammaṃ deseti.
segments.en: Now, at that time the Buddha was teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly of laypeople.

segments.pli: “ayaṃ kho samaṇo gotamo mahatiyā gihiparisāya parivuto dhammaṃ deseti.
segments.en: “The ascetic Gotama is teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly of laypeople.

segments.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ yena samaṇo gotamo tenupasaṅkameyyaṃ vicakkhukammāyā”ti.
segments.en: Why don’t I go and pull the wool over their eyes?”

segments.pli: Atha kho māro pāpimā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
segments.en: Then Māra the Wicked went up to the Buddha and addressed him in verse:
don’t get caught up in favoring and opposing.”
out of compassion for their welfare.

segments.pli: Atha kho māro pāpimā “jānāti maṃ bhagavā, jānāti maṃ sugato”ti dukkhī dummano tatthevantaradhāyīti.
segments.en: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The Buddha knows me! The Holy One knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.

suttaplex.blurb: Māra discourages the Buddha from teaching, warning him that he will become corrupted by favoritism.
